document.docAuthor: Santanna, Manoela, Rodrigues, Everton Nei Lopes, Cizauskas, Igor & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.docTitle: Cryptachaea pilar Santanna & Rodrigues & Cizauskas & Brescovit 2019
document.masterDocTitle: On the spider genus Cryptachaea from Peru, Bolivia and cave environments in Brazil: a new species, additional descriptions and new records (Araneae, Theridiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the spider genus Cryptachaea from Peru, Bolivia and cave environments in Brazil: a new species, additional descriptions and new records (Araneae, Theridiidae)

heading.emphasis:
Cryptachaea pilar Santanna
& Rodrigues , new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types . Male
Holotype
, BRAZIL : Minas Gerais , Morro do Pilar , Cave CAV-0018 ( 19°10’13’’S ; 43°23’46’’W ),
13– 17.II.2012
, L. Tunes coll., manual collection (
IBSP 189596
)
.
Paratypes
. BRAZIL : Same data as holotype , 1F (
IBSP 189596
)
;
Same data as holotype , except
03–14/VI/2013
, Equipe Carste coll., 1M, 2F (
IBSP 189609
)
;
Minas Gerais , Sete Lagoas , Cave ILCOM-14 ( 19°29’47”S ; 44°13’16”W ),
05–14.VIII.2013
, Equipe Carste coll., manual collec- tion, 1F (
IBSP 189573
)
;
Minas Gerais , Santa Maria de Itabira , Cave Morro Escuro ( 19°24’14”S ; 43°08’36”W ),
24.VI–05.VII.2013
, Equipe Carste coll., manual collection, 1F (
IBSP 189621
)
.
Etymology. The species name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality.

Diagnosis . The male palpus of
Cryptachaea pilar
new species
differs from the other species of the genus by their very large, subquadrangular tegulum that ventrally covers all the embolus ( Figs. 1 , 20, 22 ), and apex of the cymbium without projections ( Figs. 1, 2 , 20–22 ). The female have two circular copulatory openings ( Figs. 3, 4 , 25 ), as
Cryptachaea cidae
Rodrigues & Poeta, 2015
(see
Rodrigues & Poeta, 2015
: fig. 1b), but differ from this species by the oval spermathecae ( Figs. 3, 4 ), more separated from each other and fertilization ducts inserted submedianally in the spermathecae ( Fig. 4 ), posteriorly in
C. cidae
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Cryptachaea pilar Santanna
& Rodrigues, new species : 1–2, Male: 1, Palp, ventral. 2, Palp, expanded. 3–4, Female, 3, Epigynum, ventral. 4, Dorsal, clarified. Scale bars 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female paratype
( IBSP 189573). Total length 2.07. Carapace: length 0.98, width 0.92. Clypeus height: 0.14. Sternum: length 0.54, width 0.52. Chelicerae: length 0.31, width 0.12. Abdomen: length: 1.26, width 1.09, height 1.09. Leg formula I/IV/II/III. Segment length (I/II/III/IV): femora 1.21/0.96/0.65/1.19; patellae+tibiae 1.42/1.02/0.77/1.26; metatarsi+tarsi 1.68/0.86/0.67/1.34; total: 4.32/2.85/2.1/3.80. Palp: femora 0.21, patellae 0.16, tibiae 0.12, tarsi 0.14. PME larger than the other eyes; other eyes are the same size. Color of carapace ( Fig. 10 ), legs and abdomen as in male. Epigynum with epigynal plate wider than long ( Figs. 3 , 25 ), with two spherical copulatory openings ( Figs. 3 , 25 ), two oval spermathecae ( Fig. 3 ), and short fertilization and copulatory ducts ( Fig. 4 ).

Variation. Males (n=2): Total length 1.57–1.89. Carapace: length 0.71–0.73, width 0.67–0.73. Femur leg I 1.11–1.26. Females (n= 5): Total length 2.07–2.73. Carapace: length 0.98–1.36, width 0.81–1.19. Femur leg I 1.21– 1.57.
Distribution. Brazil (caves in states of São Paulo and Minas Gerais , Fig. 32 ).
